1.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to

2.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation)

3.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
guiltiness, a fault, the presentation of asin-offering
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

a bullock (apparently as breaking forth in wild strength, or perhaps as dividing the hoof)

beef cattle or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for plowing); collectively, a herd
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth
